subject: history
title: Revolt of 1857: Timeline of Events
description: Chronological progression of the First War of Independence from outbreak to suppression

phases.name: Outbreak Phase
phases.description: Initial incidents and spread of revolt

events.title: Dum Dum Arsenal Incident
events.description: Greased cartridges introduced at Dum Dum arsenal near Calcutta

points: New Enfield rifle cartridges allegedly greased with cow and pig fat
Rumours spread rapidly across army units
details.significance: First spark that led to the revolt

events.title: Mangal Pandey's Rebellion
events.description: Sepoy Mangal Pandey attacked British officers at Barrackpore

points: Called upon fellow sepoys to join
details.significance: First open act of defiance, became symbol of resistance

events.title: Meerut Outbreak
events.description: 85 sepoys imprisoned for refusing cartridges; revolt breaks out

points: 85 cavalry men refused to use cartridges on 24 April
Court-martialed and sentenced to 10 years imprisonment
Humiliated in public on parade ground
Killed British officers and released prisoners
details.significance: Marked the beginning of the organized revolt

events.title: Capture of Delhi
events.description: Rebels reach Delhi and proclaim Bahadur Shah Zafar as Emperor

points: Meerut sepoys reached Delhi on 11 May morning
Proclaimed Bahadur Shah Zafar II as Emperor of India
Reluctant emperor became symbol of revolt
details.significance: Gave legitimacy and leadership to the revolt

events.title: Kanpur Uprising
events.description: Nana Sahib leads revolt in Kanpur

points: Nana Sahib (adopted son of Peshwa Baji Rao II) became leader
British under General Wheeler besieged in entrenchment
details.significance: Brutal incidents hardened British resolve for revenge

events.title: Jhansi Joins Revolt
events.description: Rani Lakshmibai forced to take over Jhansi administration

points: Later joined revolt when British attacked
details.significance: Emergence of iconic woman leader

events.title: Siege of Lucknow Begins
events.description: British residency in Lucknow besieged by rebels

points: Sir Henry Lawrence led British defense
First relief by Havelock and Outram in September
Final relief by Colin Campbell in November
details.significance: One of longest sieges, symbol of British resistance

events.title: Bareilly Uprising
events.description: Khan Bahadur Khan proclaimed ruler of Bareilly

points: Khan Bahadur Khan, grandson of former Rohilkhand ruler, took charge
details.significance: Showed attempt at alternative governance

events.title: Siege of Delhi
events.description: British forces besiege Delhi for 4 months

points: British forces reached Ridge outside Delhi in June
Siege lasted from June to September
details.significance: Turning point - British regain symbolic capital

events.title: Recapture of Kanpur
events.description: General Havelock recaptures Kanpur

points: General Henry Havelock led British forces
Defeated Nana Sahib at Battle of Fatehpur
details.significance: Beginning of brutal British revenge

events.title: First Relief of Lucknow
events.description: Havelock and Outram reach besieged residency

points: Havelock and Outram fought through to Residency
Could not evacuate due to heavy casualties
details.significance: Temporary relief but not end of siege

events.title: Trial of Bahadur Shah Zafar
events.description: Last Mughal emperor tried for rebellion

points: Sons shot dead by Captain Hodson
details.significance: End of Mughal dynasty

events.title: Final Relief of Lucknow
events.description: Colin Campbell evacuates Lucknow residency

points: Sir Colin Campbell led relief force
details.significance: End of longest siege of revolt

events.title: Capture of Gwalior
events.description: Tatya Tope and Rani Lakshmibai capture Gwalior

points: Tatya Tope and Rani of Jhansi captured Gwalior
details.significance: Last gasp of organized revolt

events.title: Fall of Jhansi
events.description: British capture Jhansi after fierce resistance

details.significance: Fall of key rebel stronghold

events.title: Final Recapture of Lucknow
events.description: British retake Lucknow city after prolonged campaign

points: Begum Hazrat Mahal fled to Nepal
End of rebel control in Awadh capital
details.significance: Major blow to rebel morale

events.title: Death of Rani Lakshmibai
events.description: Rani of Jhansi dies fighting British at Gwalior

points: Fought in Battle of Kotah-ki-Serai near Gwalior
Dressed as man, led cavalry charge
details.significance: Martyrdom of iconic rebel leader

events.title: Recapture of Gwalior
events.description: British retake Gwalior, rebel leaders scatter

details.significance: Effective end of revolt

events.title: Peace Proclamation
events.description: Lord Canning issues peace proclamation

points: Respect for Indian customs and religions
details.significance: Official end of conflict, beginning of reconciliation

events.title: Capture of Tatya Tope
events.description: Last major rebel leader captured and executed

points: Captured by British with help of traitor
One of most capable military leaders
Guerrilla warfare against British for year
details.significance: Last major leader captured, definitive end of revolt
